examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new(
  project: "my-project-id",
  keyfile: "/path/to/keyfile.json"
)

spanner.project #=> "my-project-id"

methods.name: instances
title: Google
Cloud
Spanner
Project#instances
methods.description: Retrieves the list of instances for the given project.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

instances = spanner.instances
instances.each do |instance|
  puts instance.name
end

examples.caption: Retrieve all: (See Instance::Config::List::List#all)
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

instances = spanner.instances
instances.all do |instance|
  puts instance.name
end

params.name: token
params.description: The token value returned by the last call to instances; indicates that this is a continuation of a call, and that the system should return the next page of data.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of instances to return.

examples.caption: Will return nil if instance does not exist.
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new
instance = spanner.instance "non-existing" #=> nil

params.name: instance_id
params.description: The unique identifier for the instance.

returns.description: Returns nil if instance does not exist.

methods.name: create_instance
title: Google
Cloud
Spanner
Project#create_instance
methods.description:
Creates an instance and starts preparing it to begin serving.

See Instance::Job.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

job = spanner.create_instance "my-new-instance",
                              name: "My New Instance",
                              config: "regional-us-central1",
                              nodes: 5,
                              labels: { production: :env }

job.done? #=> false
job.reload! # API call
job.done? #=> true
instance = job.instance

params.name: instance_id
params.description: The unique identifier for the instance, which cannot be changed after the instance is created. Values are of the form [a-z][-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9] and must be between 6 and 30 characters in length. Required.

params.name: name
params.description:
The descriptive name for this instance as it
appears in UIs. Must be unique per project and between 4 and 30
characters in length. Required.

params.name: config
params.description: The name of the instance’s configuration. Values can be the instance_config_id, the full path, or an Instance::Config object. Required.

params.name: nodes
params.description:
The number of nodes allocated to this instance.
Required.

params.name: labels
params.description:
Cloud Labels are a flexible and lightweight mechanism for organizing cloud resources into groups that reflect a customer’s organizational needs and deployment strategies. Cloud Labels can be used to filter collections of resources. They can be used to control how resource metrics are aggregated. And they can be used as arguments to policy management rules (e.g. route, firewall, load balancing, etc.).

  • Label keys must be between 1 and 63 characters long and must conform to the following regular expression: [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?.
  • Label values must be between 0 and 63 characters long and must conform to the regular expression ([a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?)?.
  • No more than 64 labels can be associated with a given resource.

returns.description:
The job representing the long-running,
asynchronous processing of an instance create operation.

methods.name: instance_configs
title: Google
Cloud
Spanner
Project#instance_configs
methods.description: Retrieves a list of instance configuration for the given project.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

instance_configs = spanner.instance_configs
instance_configs.each do |config|
  puts config.name
end

examples.caption: Retrieve all: (See Instance::Config::List::List#all)
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

instance_configs = spanner.instance_configs
instance_configs.all do |config|
  puts config.name
end

params.name: token
params.description: The token value returned by the last call to instance_configs; indicates that this is a continuation of a call, and that the system should return the next page of data.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of instance configs to return.

examples.caption: Will return nil if instance config does not exist.
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new
config = spanner.instance_config "non-existing" #=> nil

params.name: instance_config_id
params.description: The instance configuration identifier. Values can be the instance_config_id, or the full path.

returns.description: Returns nil if instance configuration does not exist.

methods.name: databases
title: Google
Cloud
Spanner
Project#databases
methods.description: Retrieves the list of databases for the given project.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

databases = spanner.databases "my-instance"
databases.each do |database|
  puts database.name
end

examples.caption: Retrieve all: (See Instance::Config::List::List#all)
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

databases = spanner.databases "my-instance"
databases.all do |database|
  puts database.name
end

params.name: instance_id
params.description: The unique identifier for the instance.

params.name: token
params.description: The token value returned by the last call to databases; indicates that this is a continuation of a call, and that the system should return the next page of data.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of databases to return.

examples.caption: Will return nil if instance does not exist.
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new
database = spanner.database "my-instance", "my-database" #=> nil

params.name: instance_id
params.description: The unique identifier for the instance.

params.name: database_id
params.description: The unique identifier for the database.

returns.description: Returns nil if database does not exist.

methods.name: create_database
title: Google
Cloud
Spanner
Project#create_database
methods.description:
Creates a database and starts preparing it to begin serving.

See Database::Job.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

job = spanner.create_database "my-instance",
                              "my-new-database"

job.done? #=> false
job.reload! # API call
job.done? #=> true
database = job.database

params.name: instance_id
params.description:
The unique identifier for the instance.
Required.

params.name: database_id
params.description: The unique identifier for the database, which cannot be changed after the database is created. Values are of the form [a-z][a-z0-9_\-]*[a-z0-9] and must be between 2 and 30 characters in length. Required.

params.name: statements
params.description:
DDL statements to run inside the
newly created database. Statements can create tables, indexes, etc.
These statements execute atomically with the creation of the
database: if there is an error in any statement, the database is not
created. Optional.

returns.description:
The job representing the long-running,
asynchronous processing of a database create operation.

methods.name: session
title: Google
Cloud
Spanner
Project#session
methods.description: Creates or retrieves a session. A session can read and/or modify data in a Cloud Spanner database.

params.name: instance_id
params.description:
The unique identifier for the instance.
Required.

params.name: database_id
params.description:
The unique identifier for the database.
Required.

params.name: session_id
params.description:
The unique identifier for the database.
Optional.

returns.description: The newly created session if a session_id was not provided, or an existing session if a session_id was provided. Can return nil if the session_id provided is not found.
